Issues.Title: Safari not support truely the breakpoints ! (you should use min-width not width > or <)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Safari not support truely the breakpoints ! (you should use min-width not width > or <)" (#17185)

Issues.Title: Update @playwright/test 1.50.1 → 1.51.0 (minor)
Issues.Body:
Here is everything you need to know about this update. Please take a good look at what changed and the test results before merging this pull request. ### What changed? #### ✳️ @​playwright/test (1.50.1 → 1.51.0) · [Repo](https://github.com/Microsoft/playwright)
Release Notes

1.51.0

StorageState for indexedDB

  • New option indexedDB for browserContext.storageState() allows to save and restore IndexedDB contents. Useful when your application uses IndexedDB API to store authentication tokens, like Firebase Authentication.

    Here is an example following the authentication guide:

    // tests/auth.setup.ts
import { test as setup, expect } from '@playwright/test';
import path from 'path';

const authFile = path.join(__dirname, '../playwright/.auth/user.json');

setup('authenticate', async ({ page }) => {
  await page.goto('/');
  // ... perform authentication steps ...

  // make sure to save indexedDB
  await page.context().storageState({ path: authFile, indexedDB: true });
});

Copy prompt

New "Copy prompt" button on errors in the HTML report, trace viewer and UI mode. Click to copy a pre-filled LLM prompt that contains the error message and useful context for fixing the error.

Filter visible elements

New option visible for locator.filter() allows matching only visible elements.

// example.spec.ts
test('some test', async ({ page }) => {
  // Ignore invisible todo items.
  const todoItems = page.getByTestId('todo-item').filter({ visible: true });
  // Check there are exactly 3 visible ones.
  await expect(todoItems).toHaveCount(3);
});

Git information in HTML report

Set option testConfig.captureGitInfo to capture git information into testConfig.metadata.

// playwright.config.ts
import { defineConfig } from '@playwright/test';

export default defineConfig({
  captureGitInfo: { commit: true, diff: true }
});

HTML report will show this information when available:

Test Step improvements

A new TestStepInfo object is now available in test steps. You can add step attachments or skip the step under some conditions.

test('some test', async ({ page, isMobile }) => {
  // Note the new "step" argument:
  await test.step('here is my step', async step => {
    step.skip(isMobile, 'not relevant on mobile layouts');

    // ...
    await step.attach('my attachment', { body: 'some text' });
    // ...
  });
});

Miscellaneous

  • New option contrast for methods page.emulateMedia() and browser.newContext() allows to emulate the prefers-contrast media feature.
  • New option failOnStatusCode makes all fetch requests made through the APIRequestContext throw on response codes other than 2xx and 3xx.
  • Assertion expect(page).toHaveURL() now supports a predicate.

Browser Versions

  • Chromium 134.0.6998.35
  • Mozilla Firefox 135.0
  • WebKit 18.4

This version was also tested against the following stable channels:

  • Google Chrome 133
  • Microsoft Edge 133

Does any of this look wrong? Please let us know.

Commits

See the full diff on Github. The new version differs by more commits than we can show here.

Issues.Title: sm:grid-cols-2 and lg:grid-cols-5 in Tailwind 4
Issues.Body:
```
Item 1
Item 2
Item 3
Item 4
Item 5
``` If I remove sm:grid-cols-2 all works well with 5 columns in lg. Like in top in lg show only 2 columns. Try different variants - looks like bug.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "sm:grid-cols-2 and lg:grid-cols-5 in Tailwind 4" (#17182)

Issues.Title: Bg gradients not working on iPhone Chtome
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

For example: v4.0.6

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

For example: postcss-cli 11.0.0, Next.js 15.1.7, Vite 6.1.0

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

For example: v20.0.0

**What browser are you using?**

For example: Chrome, Safari, or N/A

**What operating system are you using?**

For example: macOS, Windows

**Reproduction URL**

A Tailwind Play link or public GitHub repo that includes a minimal reproduction of the bug. **Please do not link to your actual project**, what we need instead is a _minimal_ reproduction in a fresh project without any unnecessary code. This means it doesn't matter if your real project is private/confidential, since we want a link to a separate, isolated reproduction anyways.

A reproduction is **required** when filing an issue — any issue opened without a reproduction will be closed and you'll be asked to create a new issue that includes a reproduction. We're a small team and we can't keep up with the volume of issues we receive if we need to reproduce each issue from scratch ourselves.

**Describe your issue**

Describe the problem you're seeing, any important steps to reproduce and what behavior you expect instead.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Bg gradients not working on iPhone Chtome" (#17181)

Issues.Title: Fix `-bg-conic-*` utilities
Issues.Body: The negative versions were missing the `deg` in `<number>deg` so they didn’t work whoops

Issues.Title: Update lightningcss-win32-x64-msvc 1.29.1 → 1.29.2 (patch)
Issues.Body:
Here is everything you need to know about this update. Please take a good look at what changed and the test results before merging this pull request. ### What changed? #### ✳️ lightningcss-win32-x64-msvc (1.29.1 → 1.29.2) · [Repo](https://github.com/parcel-bundler/lightningcss)
Release Notes

1.29.2

  • Update detect-libc for better compatibility by @nicksrandall in #923
  • Fix broken minification for non-opaque oklab colors by @lfesp in #901
  • Bump browserslist-rs 0.17.0 by @chenjiahan in #912
  • Add wasm compilation cfg for Browsers::load_browserslist by @CPunisher in #895
  • Fix parsing style container queries without a value – 2284653

Does any of this look wrong? Please let us know.

Commits

See the full diff on Github. The new version differs by 12 commits:

  • v1.29.2
  • bump browser compat data
  • Add wasm compilation cfg for (#895)
  • Bump browserslist-rs 0.17.0 (#912)
  • Fix parsing style container queries without a value
  • fix double hyphen when number negative and in scientific notation (#901)
  • upgrade detect-libc (#923)
  • Use same property for color function compiled output (#894)
  • fix ci?
  • Update artifact actions
  • v1.29.1
  • Fix parsing ambiguous `none` keyword in list-style shorthand

Issues.Title: Upgrade `lightningcss` to `1.29.2` in Standalone
Issues.Body:
Closes #17162
Closes #17163
Closes #17164
Closes #17165
Closes #17166
Closes #17167
Closes #17170

Noticed that there was a second place pulling in the lightningcss version numbers that wasn't covered by the previous upgrade PR. Thankfully the APIs of the node bindings are still compatible.

To avoid this mistake in the future I also exported these sub-packages as a workspace dependency so all the version strings appear right next to each other.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Upgrade `lightningcss` to `1.29.2` in Standalone" (#17169)

Merges this PR once your tests are passing and conflicts are resolved
@​depfu cancel merge
Cancels automatic merging of this PR
@​depfu close
Closes this PR and deletes the branch
@​depfu reopen
Restores the branch and reopens this PR (if it's closed)
@​depfu pause
Ignores all future updates for this dependency and closes this PR
@​depfu pause [minor|major]
Ignores all future minor/major updates for this dependency and closes this PR
@​depfu resume
Future versions of this dependency will create PRs again (leaves this PR as is)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Update turbo 2.4.2 → 2.4.4 (patch)" (#17157)

Issues.Title: v4 swaps underline and no-underline order
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

For example: v4.0.13

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

For example: Vite 6.2.1

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

For example: v22.8.0

**What browser are you using?**

N/A

**What operating system are you using?**

macOS

**Reproduction URL**

https://github.com/gschier/tailwind-reproduction

**Describe your issue**

The class order of `underline` and `no-underline` are reversed in v4 compared to v3. I have a base `Link` component that contains `underline` and (in v3) was successfully adding the `no-underline` class to disable this in special cases. This no longer works in v4.

The v4 output is as follows:

```css
@layer components;

@layer utilities {
  .no-underline {
    text-decoration-line: none
  }

  .underline {
    text-decoration-line: underline
  }
}
```

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1b8e247e-d24c-44f1-967c-bd6c29e92fbd)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "v4 swaps underline and no-underline order" (#17154)

Issues.Title: Version > 4.0.11 do not recognize dots in the custom screens breakpoints
Issues.Body:
It seems that from version `4.0.12` (included), any custom screen breakpoint (for example `1.5md`) that contains a dot is not recognized.

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

For example: v4.0.13

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

For example: Vite 5.4.14

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

For example: v22

**What browser are you using?**

For example: Chrome

**What operating system are you using?**

For example: macOS

**Describe your issue**

Using a `tailwind.config.ts` file, and using the config below it does not recognize the breakpoints with a dot. It was doing it for the previous version.


```typescript
export default {
        ...
	theme: {
		...
		screens: {
			...
			// custom viewports
			'1.5md': '896px',
			'1.5lg': '1152px',
			'1.5xl': '1408px',
			'2.5xl': '1728px',
		},
		...
	},
	...
} satisfies Config;

```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Version > 4.0.11 do not recognize dots in the custom screens breakpoints" (#17148)

Issues.Title: Fix variants with `<digit>.</digit>` are extracted correctly
Issues.Body:
This PR fixes an issue where if you use a number with a decimal in a variant then it wasn't picked up correctly. E.g.: ```
^^^^^^^^ Picked up ^^^^^^^^^^ Not picket up ``` This PR fixes that behavior by applying the same rules for utilities where a `.` is valid if it is surrounded by numbers. # Test plan 1. Added test to ensure this is picked up 2. Existing tests pass 3. Ran the extractor on a real example with the following results: | Before | After | | --- | --- | | | | They are crossed out just because it's not a default value we know in the system, but you can see that the `1.` part is also extracted now. Fixes: #17148
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Fix variants with `<digit>.</digit>` are extracted correctly" (#17153)

Issues.Title: CSS for certain classnames not being generated anymore
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

v4.0.12

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

Vite 6.2.1

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

v22.11.0

**What browser are you using?**

Chrome

**What operating system are you using?**

macOS

**Describe your issue**

Something has broken since v4.0.7. Tailwind is no longer parsing certain classNames in the code.
```typescript
const makeClassNames = () => classnames(
		size === "sm" && "h-8",
		size === "md" && "h-10",
		size === "lg" && "h-12",
		size === "xl" && "h-16"
)
```
The className is applied to my elements, but the actual css for (ex: "h-16") does not exist.
Woked fine with 4.0.7.
I'm using Vite and the vite tailwind plugin v4.0.12.

It broke my entire UI
When is this thing gonna be stable, or at least stop introducing breaking changes...?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "CSS for certain classnames not being generated anymore" (#17149)

Issues.Title: Add `@source inline(…)`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Add `@source inline(…)`" (#17147)

Issues.Title: Custom Component State Not Working with Modifiers
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

v4.0.13

**Reproduction URL**

[https://play.tailwindcss.com/V9PpCvsjHl](https://play.tailwindcss.com/V9PpCvsjHl)


**Describe your issue**

I'm experiencing an issue where component states, like an active state on a button, aren't working as expected when using the modifiers. In the example I provided (link above), I've created a simple button component with a `.btn-active` state. However, when I try to apply styles using the modifier, they don't take effect.

You can see the problem in the provided playground link, and I’ve also attached a screenshot for reference.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ecfa91af-c420-4e87-b335-8433bc01c01e)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Custom Component State Not Working with Modifiers" (#17144)

Issues.Title: Do not extract candidates containing JS string interpolation pattern `${`
Issues.Body: This PR fixes an issue where often people run into issues where they try to use string interpolation and it doesn't work. Even worse, it could result in crashes because we will actually generate CSS. This fix only filters out candidates with a pattern like `${`. If this occurs in a string position it is fine. Another solution would be to add a pre processor for JS/TS (and all thousand file extension combinations) but the problem is that you can also write JS in HTML files so we would have to pre process HTML as well which would not be ideal. # Test plan 1. Added tests to prove this works in arbitrary values, arbitrary variables in both utilities and variants. 2. Existing tests pass. 3. Some screenshots with before / after situations: Given this input: ```ts let color = '#0088cc'; let opacity = 0.8; let name = 'variable-name'; let classes = [ // Arbitrary Properties `[color:${color}]` `[${property}:value]`, `[--img:url('https://example.com?q=${name}')]`, // WONT WORK BUT VALID CSS // Arbitrary Values `bg-[${color}]`, // Arbitrary Variables `bg-(--my-${color})`, `bg-(--my-color,${color})`, // Arbitrary Modifier `bg-red-500/[${opacity}]`, `bg-red-500/(--my-${name})`, `bg-red-500/(--my-opacity,${opacity})`, // Arbitrary Variant `data-[state=${name}]:flex`, `supports-(--my-${name}):flex`, `[@media(width>=${value})]:flex`, ]; ``` This is the result: | Before | After | | --- | --- | | | | Fixes: #17054 Fixes: #15853
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Do not extract candidates containing JS string interpolation pattern `${`" (#17142)

Issues.Title: Css variable dont work with ring
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?** 3.4.17 **What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?** Vite 5.4.x **What version of Node.js are you using?** v14.21.3 **What browser are you using?** Chrome (whatever) **What operating system are you using?** Windows 11 **Reproduction URL** Private project (sorry) **Describe your issue** **screen.scss** ``` @layer base { // MSP :root { --primary-color: #ba0c2f; /* #ba0c2f */ } // GLOBUS :root.GLOBUS { --primary-color: #e87721; } } ``` tailwind.config.js ... ``` colors: { 'msp-red': 'var(--primary-color)', // '#ba0c2f', } ``` Usage in HTML / latte file ```
// BG is really red from --primary-color
// light version of blue
// light version of blue
// red, works! but i need opacity, see next line
// light version of blue ??? ``` How to handle it? I migrate project from V2 to V3 and my previous code stopped working ```
``` :( Screenshot: ![](https://is.gd/bgpQIl) Thx for help.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Css variable dont work with ring" (#17130)

Issues.Title: Broken gradient transitions on Safari
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

v4.0.12

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

Next.js 15.2.1

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

v22.12

**What browser are you using?**

Safari v18.3

**What operating system are you using?**

macOS

**Reproduction URL**

https://play.tailwindcss.com/KpmUhZuDEn

**Describe your issue**

I'm transitioning the background of an element to a gradient on hover by setting the following on my element:

`hover:from-sky-300 hover:to-indigo-500 hover:bg-gradient-to-r`

This *mostly* works fine, but the following combination causes the size of the element to glitch and cause a series of layout shifts:

* Safari
* Text size != 1rem (eg. `text-sm` or `text-xl`)
* `hover:from-* hover:to-*`
* `transition-colors`

Removing any one of those fixes the issue.

I created the same basic setup in CSS, which worked as expected:

https://jsfiddle.net/Lfse3195/2/
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Broken gradient transitions on Safari" (#17131)

Issues.Title: Safari not interpreting var for text opacity, Links defaulting to black
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

v3.3.2

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

```
       "laravel-mix": "^6.0.30",
        "postcss-cli": "^8.3.1",
        "postcss-import": "^14.0.0",
        "webpack": "^5.94.0"
```

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

v18.18.0

**What browser are you using?**

Safari (I don't own a mac but these are the bug reports I'm getting)

**What operating system are you using?**

macOS, IOS

**Reproduction URL**

I don't have that, but I do have the generated CSS:
```
a:not(.unstyled):active {
--tw-text-opacity: 1;
  color: rgb(182 132 235/var(--tw-text-opacity));
}
```

**Describe your issue**

The above generated CSS is not interpreted by safari. I am not using the text-opacity plugin, and disabling it should hopefully solve my problem by creating proper css.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Safari not interpreting var for text opacity, Links defaulting to black" (#17138)

Issues.Title: Add `mask-*` utilities for `mask-image`, `mask-composite`, etc…
Issues.Body:
This PR adds `mask-*` utilities for `mask-image`, `mask-composite`, `mask-mode`, and other related CSS properties. Note that it does **NOT** add support for `mask-border-*` properties. **This is very much a work in progress.** Here's an example of using these utilities: ```html
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet consectetur adipisicing elit. Aut temporibus adipisci impedit assumenda! Natus facere iste alias necessitatibus quos blanditiis, minima quidem repellat porro voluptatum provident et eius. Nobis, error?
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet consectetur adipisicing elit. Aut temporibus adipisci impedit assumenda! Natus facere iste alias necessitatibus quos blanditiis, minima quidem repellat porro voluptatum provident et eius. Nobis, error?
``` and what it looks like in the browser: Here you can clearly see the background color bleeds through the element, content inside is cut out, etc…
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Add `mask-*` utilities for `mask-image`, `mask-composite`, etc…" (#17134)

Issues.Title: Imported components' classes purged from tailwind regardless of tailwind.config settings. (nextjs)
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

  "tailwindcss": "^4.0.12",
 "@tailwindcss/postcss": "^4.0.12",

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

 "next": "^15.2.0",

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

v20.18.3

**What browser are you using?**

Chromium 134.0.6998.45

**What operating system are you using?**

Windows 10

**Reproduction URL**

Can't provide reproduction because the project structure is unique to the problem

**Describe your issue**

My project structure is as follows

src/ -- Main Project with own package.json & config
src/server/ -- Nextjs Subproject with own package.json & configs

In my nextjs project tailwind works, but I also import components from the Main project.

My tailwind.config: 

```ts
/** @type {import('tailwindcss').Config} */
module.exports = {
  content: {
    relative: true,
    files: [
      './app/**/*.{js,ts,jsx,tsx}',
      '../src/**/*.{js,ts,jsx,tsx}',
    ],
  },
  prefix: '',
}
```

And I import it via global.css as per the new v4 @config:
```css
@config "../../tailwind.config.js";
```

And I import my components via tsconfig.json aliases: 

```ts
  "paths": {
      "@Components*": ["./../components/*"],
    ...
}
```

But the imported component seem to get their styles purged, and tailwind classes don't work on them...
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Imported components' classes purged from tailwind regardless of tailwind.config settings. (nextjs)" (#17133)

Issues.Title: Prepare release 4.0.13
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Prepare release 4.0.13" (#17132)

Issues.Title: Don't extract links as arbitrary properties
Issues.Body:
Closes #17128

This PR prevents extraction of links inside square brackets as valid candidate:

```
[https://example/]
```

We do this by throwing out arbitrary properties when the value starts with a slash (`/`).

## Test plan

- Added unit test
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Don't extract links as arbitrary properties" (#17129)
